name: KeyboardShortcut
desc: Keyboard shortcuts describe combinations of keys on a keyboard that the user can press in order to activate a button or toggle.

items.name: static let cancelAction: KeyboardShortcut
items.desc: The standard keyboard shortcut for cancelling the in-progress action or dismissing a prompt, consisting of the Escape (⎋) key and no modifiers.

items.name: static let defaultAction: KeyboardShortcut
items.desc: The standard keyboard shortcut for the default button, consisting of the Return (↩) key and no modifiers.

items.name: init(KeyEquivalent, modifiers: EventModifiers)
items.desc: Creates a new keyboard shortcut with the given key equivalent and set of modifier keys.

items.name: var key: KeyEquivalent
items.desc: The key equivalent that the user presses in conjunction with any specified modifier keys to activate the shortcut.

items.name: var modifiers: EventModifiers
items.desc: The modifier keys that the user presses in conjunction with a key equivalent to activate the shortcut.

items.name: init(KeyEquivalent, modifiers: EventModifiers, localization: KeyboardShortcut.Localization)
items.desc: Creates a new keyboard shortcut with the given key equivalent and set of modifier keys.

items.name: var localization: KeyboardShortcut.Localization
items.desc: The localization strategy to apply to this shortcut.

items.name: struct Localization
items.desc: Options for how a keyboard shortcut participates in automatic localization.
